While inside Tucsons' helmet, Rat Trap quickly delivers a shot of concentra=
ted Energon via a fine needle.  He knew he had to wake up the Autobot in a =
hurry, and this was the only way he knew how.

"Sorry Wheels, gotta do this=
."

With the injection Tucson gasps for air and comes back online. The jolt=
 is enough to return his energy levels to a reasonable percentage, but not =
enough to unfreeze his body.  He could feel Rat Trap in his helmet, yet he =
sensed that he was a friend.  He remains quiet.

"And - what the slag do yo=
u expect - to get out of me? Ever - hear of the - term, Classified informat=
ion?  Well, that's what my information is.  Classified."

He says in a cold=
 tone of voice to Zarak.  His optics narrow fiercely.
He was not through fi=
ghting yet.  Rat Trap gathers a bit of courage and comes out from inside hi=
s helmet.

"Rat Trap Maximize!"

He transforms into Maximal form right in f=
ront of Zarak.

" That's right lizard lips!  He don't have ta tell you slag=
!  And know somethn' else?!  He's got more courage than all of you uglies p=
ut tagether!  He's fightn' this battle all by himself, versus you guys who =
have ta keep backn' each other up!  AND THAT GOES FOR THE FORMER AHEM, NOW =
ABSCENT RODIMUS PRIME!  GAG ME!  HE AIN'T NEVER GONNA HOLD A CANDLE UP TA O=
PTIMUS PRIME, EVER!"

Tucson gasps.

"Rat - Trap, be - careful."

Rat Trap =
grunts.

" It's true wheels!  If anyone should lead the Autobots, it's you!=
  You got the heart, the spark, the courage, the strength, the compassion, =
and the will ta fight!  No matter what came down the pike! "

Tucson sighs.=


"My - name is Tucson."

Rat Trap now stands in front of Tucson.

"Not for=
 long it ain't gonna be.  You got the spark of Optimus Prime, you're it, yo=
u're the bot!  EAT THIS RODDIE!  LONG LIVE TUCSON PRIME!"

Tucson gasps aga=
in in shock.

"Rat Trap, please, watch your words."

Rat Trap shrugs.

"Cou=
ldn't help myself, I got a big mouth for a little rat."

> Zarak straightened, crossing his arms over his chest as he coolly lo=
oked at Perceptor. "Of course" he said, the look on his face a cold blank m=
ask, revealing nothing of the inner turmoil he was dealing with. There was =
a part of him that wanted to blast the little Predacon for daring to tell h=
im anything. But the ugly thing was that Zarak still needed the extra force=
s that Hydras and his Predacons brought to the table.
> 
> So rather than c=
ommanding his Scorponok unit to open fire on the base he just nodded and sa=
id, "I apologize, I have overstepped my place."
> 
> Meanwhile Cyclonus and=
 Scourge continued to face down Dark Rodimus, the air was tense as Dark Rod=
imus' optics stared into Cyclonus, niether of them ready to back down, both=
 of them remembering the last battle they fought!
> 
> However it was Perce=
ptor that broke the deadlock as he continued giving orders . . . 
> 
> (PAS=
TE)
> 
> > The rest, we have to Keep an eye in maximal base things are beco=
ming
> > interesting lately there, Rodimus... I need you for task"
> 
> The=
 affect of the command was almost instant as Rodimus stepped back from Cycl=
onus and Scourge and looked over at Perceptor. "What'cha need Percy?" Rodim=
us said to Perceptor, happy for the moment that it was Perceptor and Hydras=
 giving orders and not Cyclonus and his lap dog.
> 
> Cyclonus, seeing the =
break in the tension also stepped back, pulling Scourge back with him. "The=
re will be another time Scourge." he said quietly, "No need to fight this o=
ut here."
> 
> Scourge nodded, "Yes, there will be." he said darkly. His op=
tics still watched Rodimus, his look almost hungry as he smiled evilly.
> 
=
> As the tensions between Cyclonus, Scourge and Rodimus cooled Zarak turned=
 to look at Tuscon, wondering what information this bot could hold. "Come" =
Zarak said to Darkhawk, "Let's see what this Auto . . . "
> 
> *BEEP*
> 
> =
Zarak was caught in mid sentence by his scanner going off, the hand held on=
e that he had been keeping trained on Tuscon. He glanced down at it, a curi=
ous look on his face. For some reason it was registering a life sign where =
there had been none before. It was located somewhere near Tuscon's head.
> =

> Zarak stepped forward to take a more careful scan . . .
